rev.diff:
Line 41: Line 41:
=== Second-stage boot loader ===
=== Second-stage boot loader ===
  +
[[Image:GRUB screenshot.png|thumb|right|[[GNU GRUB]], a bootloader]]
The small program is most often not itself an operating system, but only a second-stage boot loader, such as [[GNU GRUB|GRUB]], [[Linux Loader|LILO]] or [[NTLDR]]. It will then be able to load the operating system properly, and finally transfer execution to it. The system will initialize itself, and may load [[device driver]]s and other programs that are needed for the normal operation of the OS.
The small program is most often not itself an operating system, but only a second-stage boot loader, such as [[GNU GRUB|GRUB]], [[Linux Loader|LILO]] or [[NTLDR]]. It will then be able to load the operating system properly, and finally transfer execution to it. The system will initialize itself, and may load [[device driver]]s and other programs that are needed for the normal operation of the OS.
